content:
So, with all the talk about foreign types and such, it takes some effort to track down documentation for that rust feature. I had to:

  • Find the original chalk issue,
  • look at the code example (luckily there was one) and notice that it uses #![feature(extern_types)]...
  • Look that up in the Rust Unstable Book...
  • which links to the tracking issue
  • which links to the RFC and PR that implements it

Would it be an idea to have an index of rust features that are relevant to chalk in the chalk book, with code examples? Of course the unstable book (sometimes) has a description, but that includes a lot of features that aren't relevant to trait solving.
While working on chalk I often have to look up rust features that I'm not yet familiar with, and I imagine I'm not the only one
